DataElement.preferredName: Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Diseases and Disorders Performance Status Score
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the score to measure of how well a patient with chronic graft versus host disease, a syndrome of immologically mediated tissue damage occurring following allogeneic transplant and may affect multiple organs with manifestations similar to autoimmune diseases with an onset usually within three years of transplantation or immunologic manipulation, is able to perform ordinary tasks and carry out daily activities.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Diseases and Disorders Performance Status
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the measure of how well a patient with chronic graft versus host disease, a syndrome of immologically mediated tissue damage occurring following allogeneic transplant and may affect multiple organs with manifestations similar to autoimmune diseases with an onset usually within three years of transplantation or immunologic manipulation, is able to perform ordinary tasks and carry out daily activities.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Diseases and Disorders
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A syndrome of immologically mediated tissue damage occurring following allogeneic transplant and may affect multiple organs with manifestations similar to autoimmune diseases.  Onset is usually within three years of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.:A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, and may affect multiple organs with manifestations similar to autoimmune diseases. The onset is usually within three years of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: A measure of how well a patient is able to perform ordinary tasks and carry out daily activities.

Concepts.definition: A measure of how well a patient is able to perform ordinary tasks and carry out daily activities.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: information on quality of patient life and ability to function

ValueDomain.preferredName: Chronic Graft Versus Host Disease Performance Status Score
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Asymptomatic and fully active (ECOG 0; KPS or LPS 100%)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Asymptomatic and fully active (ECOG 0; KPS or LPS 100%)
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Asymptomatic and fully active (ECOG 0; KPS or LPS 100%)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Symptomatic, fully ambulatory, restricted only in physically strenuous activity (ECOG 1, KPS or LPS 80-90%)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Symptomatic, fully ambulatory, restricted only in physically strenuous activity (ECOG 1, KPS or LPS 80-90%)
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Symptomatic, fully ambulatory, restricted only in physically strenuous activity (ECOG 1, KPS or LPS 80-90%)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Symptomatic, ambulatory, capable of selfcare, >50% of waking hours out of bed (ECOG 2, KPS or LPS 60-70%)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Symptomatic, ambulatory, capable of selfcare, >50% of waking hours out of bed (ECOG 2, KPS or LPS 60-70%)
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Symptomatic, ambulatory, capable of selfcare, >50% of waking hours out of bed (ECOG 2, KPS or LPS 60-70%)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Symptomatic, limited self-care, >50% of waking hours in bed (ECOG 3-4, KPS or LPS <60%)

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Symptomatic, limited self-care, >50% of waking hours in bed (ECOG 3-4, KPS or LPS <60%)
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Symptomatic, limited self-care, >50% of waking hours in bed (ECOG 3-4, KPS or LPS <60%)

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition:
any unfavorable symptoms, signs, or disease temporally associated with the use of a medical
treatment or procedure that may or may not be considered related to the medical
treatment or procedure.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.

Concepts.definition: A number or range of numeric values measuring performance, function, quality, or ability.
